derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: the adjective from Latin supinus 'bent backwards' (related to super 'above'); the noun from late Latin supinum, neuter of supinus

entry.def: If you are supine, you are lying flat on your back.

example.ex: ...bedridden persons confined to the supine position.
example.tran: 那些只能平躺在床上的久病不起的人。
一只仰卧姿势的狗的雕像

entry.tran: 懒散的;得过且过的;软弱的
entry.def: If you describe someone as supine, you mean that they let events happen because they are too lazy or afraid to influence them.

example.tran: 一个为人和气、得过且过的主管

sentences.sentence: "No other colony showed such supine, selfish helplessness in allowing her own border citizens to be mercilessly harried"- Theodore Roosevelt
